snippet: Harvard and a private company are creating a searchable database of American case law to be on the Internet for free, allowing instant retrieval of vital records that had been available, for a price.
abstract: Harvard University Law School Library is dismantling and scanning all but the rarest volumes in its collection in order to create free, searchable database of American case law; project will guarantee basic floor of legal information for everyone, and is supported by start-up Ravel Law, which hopes to make money by offering sophisticated analytical tools for fee.
lead_paragraph: Harvard and a private company are creating a searchable database of American case law to be on the Internet for free, allowing instant retrieval of vital records that had been available, for a price.

headline.print_headline: Sacrificing a Legal Trove for the Digital Age
headline.main: Harvard Law Library Readies Trove of Decisions for Digital Age
